Description: Fragment of foot and lower wall a black-glazed pottery cup; tall ring foot, stamped eight-petal rosette at the centre of the floor; underside of the foot reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
A common product in Campana A, which is not found in any quantity in Egypt.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GR.13)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2985 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
